faq.question: Are the Syriacs and the Arameans the same people?
faq.answer: Yes, Native Syrians are the direct descendant of the Arameans. "Syriac; Syrian" is a Greek term meaning Aramean.

faq.question: What happened to the Aramean homeland?
faq.answer: The Aramean homeland (Aram & Aram Naharaim) was conquered by many non-indigenous people such as Assyrians, Persians, Romans, Arabs, Ottomans, Kurds, etc., however, Syria (Aram) is considered the modern homeland of the Arameans, but under Arab rule.

faq.question: Why do Arameans call themselves Chaldeans or Assyrians?
faq.answer:
During the Colonization of the Middle East, groups of Arameans pledged alliances to Westerners and accepted the Middle East plan, in the hope of being independent, safe, and protected.

The terms Assyrian and Chaldean were chosen accordingly to the geographical location of the Assyrian and Babylonian provinces.

The Syriac Churches of the East and the national separatist movements propagated the new identities amongst the people and created bogus ethnologies.

faq.question: Is Aramaic the language of Jesus?
faq.answer: Yes, Jesus and his disciples primarly spoke Aramaic.

faq.question: How old is the Aramaic language?
faq.answer: Aramaic has been around for more than 3,000 years
